\title[panel]{Panel Data}
\author[]{Zhentao Shi}
\date[]{The Chinese University of Hong Kong}

\begin{document}

\frame{\titlepage}

% Uncomment if you want a table of contents slide
% \begin{frame}
%     \tableofcontents
% \end{frame}


\begin{frame}{Pooled Cross Sections}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Cross-sectional datasets collected at different time points  
        \item Group-specific intercept  
        \item Analysis of time trends  
        \item Example: Time trend of migrant workers' wages in Shenzhen
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}



\begin{frame}{Panel Data Structure}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item The same individuals are observed over time $t=1,\ldots,T$  
        \item Independent across $i=1,\ldots,N$  
        \item Temporal dependence is allowed within a \textbf{group} over $t=1,\ldots,T$ for the same $i$.  
            \begin{equation}
                y_{it}=\beta_{1}+x_{it}'\beta_{2}+\varepsilon_{it} \label{eq:basic_eq}
            \end{equation}  
            with $E(\varepsilon_{it} ) = 0$.
        \item \textbf{Composite error}: 
        $$\varepsilon_{it}=\alpha_{i} + u_{it}$$         with $\mathrm{cov} (u_{it}, x_{it}) = 0$
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}



\begin{frame}{Fixed Effects}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Consistency of OLS counts on 
        $\mathrm{cov}(\varepsilon_{it}, x_{it}) = \mathrm{cov}(\alpha_{i}, x_{it}) + \mathrm{cov}(u_{it},x_{it})=0$.
        
        \item Example
        \begin{itemize}
            \item Production function (Mundlak, 1961)
 $$y_{it}=\beta_{1}+x_{it}'\beta_{2}+ m_i \gamma + u_{it} $$
 where $m_i$ is the ``management quality'' of a firm (usually unobservable).
        \item $m_i\gamma$, which can be correlated with $x_{it}$, is captured by $\alpha_i$
        \end{itemize}
        
        \item The \textbf{fixed effect} $\alpha_{i}$ can be potentially endogenous (correlated with $x_{it}$)
    
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}




\begin{frame}{Static Linear Model}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Model 
        \begin{align*}
          y_{it} & =\beta_{1}+x_{it}'\beta_{2}+\varepsilon_{it}  \\  
                 & =(\beta_{1}+ \alpha_i) +x_{it}'\beta_{2}+ u_{it}  \\
                 & = \alpha_{1i} +x_{it}'\beta_{2}+ u_{it}  
        \end{align*}
    where $ \alpha_{1i} = \beta_{1}+ \alpha_i$ is the new intercept

\bigskip

    \item $(N+K)$ Parameters $(\alpha_{1i},\alpha_{2i}, \ldots, \alpha_{Ni}; \beta_2) $
        
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}



\begin{frame}{Least Squares Dummy Variable Estimator}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Direct Estimation 
        $$y_{it} = \sum_{j=1}^N \alpha_{1j} \mathbf{I}(i=j) +x_{it}'\beta_{2}+u_{it}  $$
    \end{itemize}
    
    
    \textcolor{red}{draw a diagram}
\end{frame}



\begin{frame}{Within-Group Transformation}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Inner-outer optimization: given any $\beta_2$, the OLS estimator
        $$\hat{\alpha}_{1i} = T^{-1} \sum_{t=1}^T (y_{it} - x'_{it} \beta_2)
          = \bar{y}_{i} - \bar{x}'_{i} \beta_2, $$
          where $\bar{y}_i$ is the \textbf{within group average}, and so is $\bar{x}_i$.
        \item Substitute $\hat{\alpha}_{1i}$ into $y_{it} = \alpha_{1i} +x_{it}'\beta_{2}+ u_{it}$ and rearrange:
        $$\tilde{y}_{it}=\tilde{x}_{it}\beta_{2}+\tilde{u}_{it}$$
         where $\tilde{y}_{it}=y_{it}-\overline{y}_{i}$ is the \textbf{within-group transformation}, and  $\tilde{x}_{it}$ and $\tilde{u}_{it}$ are defined similarly
         
        \item The $N$ parameters $(\alpha_{1i})_{i=1}^N$ are eliminated
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}







\begin{frame}{Within Estimator}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Within estimator:
        \[
            \widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}=\left(\tilde{X}'\tilde{X}\right)^{-1}\tilde{X}'\tilde{y}  
        \]
        \item Consistency is achieved if strict exogeneity holds.
    \end{itemize} 
    \begin{assumption*}[FE.1]
        $E\left[u_{it}|\alpha_{i},\mathbf{x}_{i}\right]=0$ where $\mathbf{x}_{i}=\left(x_{i1},\ldots,x_{iT}\right)$. 
    \end{assumption*} 
    \begin{assumption*}[FE.2]
     $\mathrm{var}\left(u_{i}|\alpha_{i},\mathbf{x}_{i}\right)=\sigma_{u}^{2}I_{T}$. 
    \end{assumption*}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Variance Estimation for FE}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Under homoskedasticity:
        \[
            \widehat{\sigma}_{u}^{2}=\frac{1}{n\left(T-1\right)}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\widehat{\tilde{u}}_{it}^{2}.
        \]
        where $\widehat{\tilde{u}}=\tilde{y}_{it}-\tilde{x}_{it}\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}$  
    \end{itemize}
    \begin{theorem}[FE Asymptotic Normality]
        If FE.1 and FE.2 hold, then
        \[
            \left(\widehat{\sigma}_{u}^{2}\left(\tilde{X}'\tilde{X}\right)^{-1}\right)^{-1/2}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}-\beta_{2}^{0}\right)\Rightarrow N\left(0,I_{K}\right).
        \]
    \end{theorem}
\end{frame}

\subsection{Random Effect}
\frame{\subsectionpage}

\begin{frame}{Random Effect}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item $\mathrm{cov}(\alpha_{i},x_{it})=0$.  
    \end{itemize}
    \begin{assumption*}[RE.1]
        $E\left[u_{it}|\alpha_{i},\mathbf{x}_{i}\right]=0$ and $E\left[\alpha_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i}\right]=0$.  
    \end{assumption*}
    \[S=\mathrm{var}\left(\varepsilon_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i}\right)=\sigma_{\alpha}^{2}\mathbf{1}_{T}\mathbf{1}_{T}'+\sigma_{u}^{2}I_{T},\ \mbox{for all }i=1,\ldots,n.  
    \]
    \begin{itemize}
        \item rewrite (\ref{eq:basic_eq}) 
            \[
            y_{it}=w_{it}\boldsymbol{\beta}+\varepsilon_{it},
            \]
            where $\boldsymbol{\beta}=\left(\beta_{1},\beta_{2}'\right)'$ and
            $w_{it}=\left(1,x_{it}\right)$ are $K+1$ vectors  
        \item the GLS estimator is:
            \[
            \widehat{\boldsymbol{\beta}}^{RE}=\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbf{w}_{i}'S^{-1}\mathbf{w}_{i}\right)^{-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbf{w}_{i}'S^{-1}\mathbf{y}_{i}=\left(W'\mathbf{S}^{-1}W\right)^{-1}W'\mathbf{S}^{-1}y
            \]
            where $\mathbf{S}=I_{T}\otimes S$
    \end{itemize} 
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Random Effect}
    \begin{assumption*}[RE.2]
        $\mathrm{var}\left(u_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i},\alpha_{i}\right)=\sigma_{u}^{2}I_{T}$
    and $\mathrm{var}\left(\alpha_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i}\right)=\sigma_{\alpha}^{2}.$
    \end{assumption*}  
    \begin{itemize}
        \item $\widehat{u}_{it}=y_{it}-x_{it}\widehat{\boldsymbol{\beta}}^{RE}$  
        \item \begin{eqnarray*}
            \widehat{\sigma}_{u}^{2} &=& \frac{1}{nT}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\widehat{u}_{it}^{2},   \\
            \widehat{\sigma}_{u}^{2} &=& \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{T(T-1)}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\sum_{r=1}^{T}\sum_{r\neq t}\widehat{u}_{it}\widehat{u}_{ir}.
        \end{eqnarray*}
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}


\begin{frame}{Hausman Test}

    \begin{itemize}
        \item Tests for correlation between $\alpha_{i}$ and $x_{it}$.  
        \item Null hypothesis: $\mathrm{cov}(\alpha_{i},x_{it})=0$.  
        \item Test statistic:
        \begin{align*}
            &\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}-\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{RE}\right)^{'}\left(\widehat{Avar}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}\right)-\widehat{Avar}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{RE}\right)\right)^{-1}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}-\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{RE}\right)\\
            &\Rightarrow \chi^{2}(K)
        \end{align*}
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\end{frame}
